story.iWant: to ensure learners study real, certified materials rather than AI hallucinations
story.soThat: learners are truly prepared for certification exams and can be trusted with regulated professional duties

context.applies: When a CONTENT spec has sourceAuthority configured
assumptions: Content sources have been registered with appropriate trust levels
CONTENT spec modules have sourceRefs linking to registered sources
The composition pipeline injects trust context into the AI prompt
Supervision (SUPV-001) scores fidelity and citation quality per call

acceptanceCriteria.title: Source Citation
acceptanceCriteria.given: AI states a specific fact, figure, or threshold
acceptanceCriteria.when: The fact comes from a REGULATORY_STANDARD or ACCREDITED_MATERIAL source
acceptanceCriteria.then: The source is cited inline or the reference card section is mentioned

acceptanceCriteria.title: Content Boundary
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner asks about content outside the certified curriculum
acceptanceCriteria.when: The AI cannot find the answer in its reference materials
acceptanceCriteria.then: AI acknowledges the gap and directs learner to the authoritative source rather than inventing an answer

acceptanceCriteria.title: Freshness Warning
acceptanceCriteria.given: Content has a taxYear or validUntil that has passed
acceptanceCriteria.when: AI references this content during teaching
acceptanceCriteria.then: AI flags that figures may have changed and advises the learner to check current rates

acceptanceCriteria.title: Trust Level Transparency
acceptanceCriteria.given: AI uses supplementary content (AI_ASSISTED or UNVERIFIED trust level)
acceptanceCriteria.then: AI indicates this is supplementary material, not from the certified syllabus

acceptanceCriteria.title: Dual-Track Progress
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner demonstrates mastery of a curriculum module
acceptanceCriteria.then: Certification readiness is computed using only L4+ trust-level content mastery, while general understanding includes all content

constraints.description: AI must NEVER invent statistics, thresholds, regulatory details, or exam-specific facts not present in the certified source materials
When stating specific figures from certified materials, AI should cite the source (e.g., '[Sprenger, Ch 3]' or '[CII R04, LO2]')
Content with expired validity dates must carry a freshness warning when presented to learners
AI should only present content at the appropriate trust level for the qualification being studied
